task.title: Task: Scatter (XY) Chart
task.shortdesc: A scatter chart (XY diagram) is very suitable if you want to analyze and show the relationship between two numeric variables. It also allows you to determine a trend line.

context.p: In a Scatter Chart, also called XY Chart, the values of two numeric variables are plotted against each other. Each pair makes a point in the chart. A scatter chart is often used to examine a certain relation, a correlation, between the two variables.

section.title: Problem
section.p: To investigate whether there is a relationship between body length and weight the data is measured for 10 students. The measurement data is shown in the following figure.
The data should be displayed in a scatter chart, as shown in the following figure.

step.cmd: Choose Insert Insert Scatter (XY) or Bubble Chart (group Charts) Scatter .

stepresult.p: The chart appears in the worksheet. There are still some adjustments to be made.

step.cmd: Change the chart title in Relation body length - weight.
Create a horizontal axis title with text Length (cm).
Create a vertical axis title with text Weight (kg).
Change the scale of the horizontal axis so that it runs from 160 to 190, with increments of 5.
Change the scale of the vertical axis so that it runs from 40 to 80, with increments of 5.
